messages.text: Streaming right now on Javis development! Getting back into the swing of things now and will start working on the next iteration of Javis! Super excited to say that thanks to the work of <@ULX78CTC3>, we will possibly be making Javis have full feature parity in Jupyter notebooks! Will be reviewing some issues and PRs today and maybe get to some blogging about projects I have been up to! Come join here: <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

attachments.title: ANN: Announcing DoctorDocstrings.jl
attachments.text: Hello all! DoctorDocstrings.jl is a package that will help you enhance your REPL workflow for adding docstrings to your package. It is very simple, alpha, and hardcoded (for now). Dear lord don’t judge me from the janky hacks it’s awful awful. But it works! The idea is to listdocs($MyPackage) to know see all exports in your package/module and true/false for having docstrings/examples. diagnosedocs($MyPackage) if you only want to know the ones that are missing docstrings Now that you know ...

messages.text: Hey everyone! Streaming right now on setting up a free Franklin.jl based website on GitHub with thanks and appreciation to <@UDP5WL2RX> who ported my theme, <https://mmistakes.github.io/so-simple-theme/|So Simple>, to Franklin! We will work on porting some of my website over to deploying it from Franklin while I check for bugs with the theme! Going on from there, I'm also going to do some review of basic sorting algorithms and learn about them! Feel free to join in, hang out, and say hello! <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

messages.text: Hi eveyone! Streaming today on more Franklin.jl shenanigans as we continue to modify and introduce new content for the port of the So Simple theme! Afterwards, I am going to continue my studying of sorting algorithms, big oh notation, and maybe fundamental data structures such as trees time permitting! Come hang out, ask your questions, or say hey! <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

messages.text: Hey everyone! I am gauging interest on possibly adding a new component to my streaming topics as well as a fun new way of interacting with y'all during streams!

elements.text: Hey everyone! I am gauging interest on possibly adding a new component to my streaming topics as well as a fun new way of interacting with y'all during streams!

messages.text: The first is I am an independent learner and I love to study. Anywhere from papers to languages fall under the purview of my interests! As a result, I have developed quite a mature personal learning system that I have both written about here and there as well as use to study on my own. It has gotten to the point where members from other learning communities - not just the Julia one - are curious about my learning habits. I am thinking about adding this component into my streams to both reach a bigger audience, engage and educate others on learning habits I have developed (and of course to learn from others!), and also to explore this hobby of mine that I enjoy. In future streams with this component, we would still have programming and issue tracking and software development. With this new component, there just might be sessions where I focus more on learning or less depending on how I feel. What do people think of that idea?

messages.text: The second is hats! I had a lot of fun wearing my goofy santa hat for the holiday season and think it might be fun to keep the trend going! I have a few more goofy hats that I have just acquired and was thinking that may be a fun way to interact with you guys! Perhaps we could have polls or some sort of in-stream voting about what hat I should wear. Think this would be a fun idea? :tophat:

messages.text: Hi everyone! As a result of the poll from this past weekend, I am happy to introduce a new format to my streams! For some parts of my streams going forward, I will be also showing my studying/self-teaching habits while doing research! I have had many members of my audience asking about my interest in this area and am happy to now share it with you all! Also, I do plan on incorporating fun hats too - I haven't quite got that idea fleshed out fully yet, but it is getting there! Here were the results from the poll in case you were wondering:

messages.text: Happy New Year! :tada: :tada: :tada: Starting a late night quiet stream! We will be doing some studying, tweaking some learning tools that I wrote in Julia, and examining Franklin.jl! My goal is to get the new So Simple theme for Franklin with <@UDP5WL2RX> ready for you all soon! Feel free to join in, chill out to some low-key music, and say hello! <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

messages.text: Hey everyone, doing a research & Julia dev stream! Going to do some incremental reading on computable phenotypes, make some Anki flashcards, doodle ideas, and then work on Javis.jl, Franklin.jl, and JAnki.jl. I have been working on JAnki.jl off and on since June and it's funny to see but people are really intrigued by the tool! Trying to make it more user friendly and fun to use. :smile: Feel free to join in and chill, ask questions, or say hello! Link: <https://twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

messages.text: Hi gang! Going to do a research and Julia programming stream! Continuing to read on computable phenotypes as well as some general research on neo-colonialism and learning tools! After reading, we will work with Anki and my personal knowledge base - my Zettelkasten - some as well. Finally, going to work some more on getting a theme prepared for Franklin.jl and work some more on JAnki.jl. If we have time, also want to clean up some code and documentation for the NeuriViz project as well! :) Feel free to swing by, bring some tea :tea:, kick  back and say hello, ask questions, and chill out with me! :D <https://twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

elements.text: Hey! Saw these messages over at Humans of Julia and wanted to cross post over here to give y'all an update on what I have been up to!

messages.text:
In short, I have been quite busy! Been recently going through onboarding and getting up to speed on projects so it has been quite an adventure! I am hoping to stream this weekend and get back into a bit more of a normal schedule with streaming as I am working on a new personal project as well as continuing development of Javis. I want to discuss an idea I have with my employers at some point about incorporating streaming into my day job and my open source work as I do a lot of it! As I was getting hired they really loved the educational outreach portion of the stream that I maintained while I worked through projects. I don't think they are opposed but not comfortable asking about it _just_ yet.

I'll update more in the future as I find out more.

Keep rocking on! :deciduous_tree:

elements.text: Live right now:

messages.text:
Hi everyone! I am streaming right now! Feel free to join in as I work through some of my day to day studies, solving some issues on Javis.jl, and make some progress on a new project I am slowly developing called "Serendipty.jl" with <@U014MUBKTQE>. "Serendipity.jl" makes use of natural langauge processing methods to extract information from - at the moment - research papers to help one quickly parse through and find relevant pieces of information. "Serendipity.jl" is part of what I am envisioning to be a whole suite of personal learning tools written in Julia to help one with their learning and knowledge management.

As I have now settled in some to my job, I am going to start with streaming on the weekends at first and then see what else I can find time for/make room for. In the future, I do want to see if I can stream during my day job - I'll keep you apprised! Anyhow, feel free to join in, bring some tea, and hang out while I work on things! All welcome! <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

attachments.title: TheCedarPrince - Twitch
attachments.text: My name is Jacob Zelko! I am a Research Engineer at Georgia Tech Research Institute. I program in Julia, Python, and R. I try to make my programming more social so, welcome to the stream one and all!

"Serendipity.jl" makes use of natural langauge processing methods to extract information from - at the moment - research papers to help one quickly parse through and find relevant pieces of information. "Serendipity.jl" is part of what I am envisioning to be a whole suite of personal learning tools written in Julia to help one with their learning and knowledge management.

As I have now settled in some to my job, I am going to start with streaming on the weekends at first and then see what else I can find time for/make room for. In the future, I do want to see if I can stream during my day job - I'll keep you apprised! Anyhow, feel free to join in, bring some tea, and hang out while I work on things! All welcome!
